Articles.Content:
I strike again! I have made my third and final cinematic video.

Once again, I would really appreciate it if you guys could watch these videos and perhaps give me some tips and constructive criticism.

Please do like, comment and even subscribe, Thanks!

Part I:

Part II:

Part III (Better quality woo!):

Please be nice when commenting, as I do put a lot of effort into these videos.

Thank you.

-EliteShadowLeo:cool:

Nice images, music not so much.

Though it looks more like a showcase than gameplay.

Very pretty.

In the 3rd video lateral panning shots look very much like 1 layer moving over a background still. The landscape shots similarly look like multiple static layers moving over a background still. The first 2 videos and parts of the third show nice 3 dimensionality and some beautiful effects. It's tricky to show realistic relative motion I guess without time lapse or high detail / multiple objects in shot.

The jiggling points of the mountains in a few shots are a bit jarring but they're mainly what convinced me it was 3d. kind of a problem I guess.

What's the gameplay going to be aboot?

Yeah, I agree. I've been having trouble naming it. Thank you for your comment! In the future I will change the music a bit, I will try some more classical pieces of music such as Beethoven's Moonlight Sonata.

Edited February 9, 2014 by EliteShadowLeo

Thanks for your comment, I will use this advice so I can better make videos in the future. I've noticed that the name is slightly misleading so I will be renaming it so that it better suits the video. Like you also mentioned, I will try to avoid the Jigging points of the mountains in the future.

Once again, thanks!

Edited February 9, 2014 by EliteShadowLeo
